lessons.title: Basic structure of an HTML document
lessons.info:
Lesson Content: In this lesson, we will be learning about the basic structure of an HTML document. HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language, and it is used to create and structure content on the web. To create an HTML document, we start with the doctype declaration, which tells the browser what version of HTML we are using. It looks like this: Next, we have the HTML tag, which tells the browser that everything within it is an HTML document. We then have the two main sections of an HTML document: the head and the body. The head section contains information about the document, including the title, meta data, and links to external resources such as stylesheets. The body section contains the actual content of the document, including headings, paragraphs, images, and links. Example: ``` My Webpage

Welcome to My Webpage!

This is a paragraph of text.

Click me! ``` Quiz: 1. What does the doctype declaration do? 2. What are the two main sections of an HTML document? Answers: 1. The doctype declaration tells the browser what version of HTML we are using. 2. The two main sections of an HTML document are the head and the body.

lessons.title: Creating headings, paragraphs, and lists in HTML
lessons.info:
Lesson: Creating Headings, Paragraphs, and Lists in HTML In HTML, headings are used to add structure to a document, making it easier for search engines to identify important content. The six levels of headings available in HTML include h1 through h6. The h1 tag creates the largest and most prominent heading, while h6 creates the smallest. To create a heading in HTML, simply enclose the text you want to use as a heading within the appropriate h1 through h6 tags. For example, the code

would create a large and prominent heading. Paragraphs are used to organize text into blocks of content. To create a paragraph in HTML, simply enclose the desired text within the

lessons.title: Adding links and images to an HTML document
lessons.info: Lesson Content: In HTML, you can add hyperlinks and images to your web pages, which can provide additional information for your users and enhance the overall user experience. To add a hyperlink to your HTML document, you will use the a tag with the href attribute. The href attribute specifies the URL of the web page you want to link to. For example, the following code will create a hyperlink to the Google website: `Click here to visit Google` Similarly, to add an image to your HTML document, you will use the img tag with the src attribute. The src attribute specifies the path to the image file. For example, the following code will display an image named "example.jpg" located in the same directory as your HTML file: `` Remember to also include the alt attribute for every image on your webpage, as it provides an alternative text description for the image if it can't be displayed. Practice problem: Create a hyperlink to the Wikipedia page about HTML on your webpage. Also, add the image "example.png" to your webpage. Solution: `Learn more about HTML on Wikipedia` `` Summary: Hyperlinks and images are essential elements in web development. In this lesson, we learned how to add hyperlinks and images to an HTML document using the a and img tags respectively. Remember to include the necessary attributes to optimize the user experience.

The basic structure of an HTML document
lessons.info:
Lesson: Basic Structure of an HTML Document In HTML, the basic structure of a document relies on several elements. These are: 1) - defines the document type and specifies that it’s an HTML document 2) - contains meta-information about the document, such as the page title and links to external files like stylesheets and scripts 3) - specifies the title of the document, which appears in the browser tab and as the title in search engine results 4) <body> - contains all the elements that make up the visible content on the web page Here's an example: <!DOCTYPE html> <html> <head> <meta charset="UTF-8"> <title>Example Page

This is the main heading

This is a paragraph of text

In this example, we see the basic structure of an HTML document: - The declaration is used to define the document type and ensure proper rendering in different browsers - The element contains everything in the document - The element contains meta-information about the document - The element specifies the title of the document - The <body> element contains the content that will be displayed in the web browser Quiz: 1. What does the <!DOCTYPE html> declaration define? 2. What does the <head> element contain? 3. What does the <body> element contain? Answers: 1. The <!DOCTYPE html> declaration defines the document type and ensures proper rendering in different browsers. 2. The <head> element contains meta-information about the document, such as the page title and links to external files like stylesheets and scripts. 3. The <body> element contains the content that will be displayed in the web browser.

lessons.title: The head section of an HTML document and its contents
lessons.info:
Lesson Content: In this lesson, we will be learning about the head section of an HTML document. The head section is the portion of the HTML document that contains the metadata for the page, which includes information such as the title, description, keywords, and stylesheets used by the document. The head section is not visible to users visiting the website, but it is important for search engine optimization (SEO). One of the most important elements in the head section is the title tag, which provides a brief description of the page’s content and is displayed in the browser’s title bar. It is recommended to keep the title tag under 70 characters so it is visible on search engine result pages. Other elements that may appear in the head section include the meta description tag, which provides a brief summary of the web page’s content, and the meta keywords tag, which lists the main keywords and phrases that are relevant to the page. Practice problem: Create a basic HTML document with a title, meta description, and meta keywords. Solution: Sample Page

Welcome to my sample page

This is an example of HTML document head section.

Quiz: 1. What is the purpose of the head section? 2. What is the title tag and why is it important? 3. What is the recommended character length for the title tag? 4. What is the meta description tag? 5. What is the meta keywords tag? Answers: 1. The head section contains the metadata for the page, which includes information such as the title, description, keywords, and stylesheets used by the document. 2. The title tag provides a brief description of the page’s content and is displayed in the browser’s title bar. It is important for SEO and visibility on search engine result pages. 3. It is recommended to keep the title tag under 70 characters. 4. The meta description tag provides a brief summary of the web page’s content. 5. The meta keywords tag lists the main keywords and phrases that are relevant to the page.

lessons.info:

The tag is enclosed by the tag that encompasses the entire HTML document. Everything that users see when browsing a web page is part of the body section. It is important to note that only the text within the element can be displayed in a browser, whereas the text within the element cannot. Example: ```html Page Title

Welcome to My Webpage

Here is some information about me.

Visit my website ``` In this example, the element contains a heading, a paragraph with some text, an image, and a link. Quiz: 1. What is the main use of the tag in HTML? 2. Can element content be displayed in a web browser? 3. What is the difference between attributes and elements in HTML? Answers: 1. The tag represents the main content of the web page and contains anything displayed on the web page such as text, images, videos, and other media. 2. No, only the text within the element can be displayed in a browser. 3. An element in HTML is defined using a tag and attribute is used to provide extra information about the elements.

lessons.title: Adding comments to an HTML document
lessons.info: Lesson: Adding comments to an HTML document Sometimes when working with HTML, it can be helpful to add comments to your code. Comments are non-executable lines of code that are used to explain sections of code or to leave notes for yourself or other developers who may read the code in the future. To add a comment in an HTML file, you can use the tags surrounding the text you want to comment out. For example, if you have a div element that you want to temporarily remove from your code, you can add a comment around it like this: To re-enable the element, simply remove the opening and closing comment tags. Comments can also be useful when working with a team of developers, allowing you to communicate any changes or notes about the code. Quiz: 1. What are comments in HTML used for? 2. How do you add a comment in an HTML file? 3. How do you remove a commented-out section of code? Answers: 1. Comments in HTML are non-executable lines of code used to explain sections of code or communicate notes about the code. 2. To add a comment in an HTML file, you can use the tags surrounding the text you want to comment out. 3. To remove a commented-out section of code, simply remove the opening and closing comment tags.
